title: Vayne can condemn and stun enemy Azir against his own wall
body: Just played a game as Azir and the enemy Vayne condemned me into my ultimate wall on two different occasions (once while ulting, and once after the ult animation had completed).  It is my understanding that the intended behavior for Azir's wall is that it act as terrain only for enemy units, but not allied units.  If this is the case, then being condemned into an enemy Azir's wall should pin me to it and stun me, but being condemned into an allied Azir wall should push me through the wall as if it weren't there, with the stun only being applied if I run into some other terrain during the condemn knockback.  If need be I can provide a replay file of the game.

> It could also be since it's an unpassable wall for Vayne, it treats it as such. Instead of checking for it being a passable wall for Azir.

As a developer, that's my best guess as to what's going on too.  It can be a pain to retroactively add additional functionality (e.g. allied and enemy terrain) because of all the existing code that has to be touched to handle the new cases correctly.  In my experience, cases often get missed.

Another possibility that occurred to me is that they've programmed the condemn bolt to be its own unit/minion (on the same team as the Vayne), and the stun is determined by the collision of that unit with terrain (after it's attached to its target) as opposed to the collision of its target with the terrain.  Someone may have thought it was easier to code it this way and figure out the knockback/stun based on character status at different points in the unit's life cycle.  Such an approach seems unintuitive to me, but again, I don't know what their code base looks like or how they handle game state.

I know I'm gonna get a lot of flame for this (and no i don't play Vayne and never have), but I think this is good counterplay and shouldn't be changed. It's terrain and it should be treated as such. :/
The entire point of Azir's ult is that he creates a wall that only blocks his enemies, and doesn't affect his allies.

I shouldn't be punished for using my abilities ESPECIALLY since it is a guaranteed stun if we cast them at the same time since my wall will conveniently spawn right behind me.

Also there isn't much counterplay involved here since one party has to make a mistake for there to be counterplay, and  last I checked me standing by my OWN wall (or simply casting the ability) is 9.99999999/10 not a mistake. Jarvan's makes more sense since you go in KNOWING you are trapping yourself in there with multiple people and you are basically going on a suicide mission anyway for the hope of AoE wombo combos. Azir typically uses the ultimate for peeling purposes to AVOID cc and getting attacked.
If you consider the idea that the enemy projectile is what triggers the pin, not the champion being knocked back, it makes sense. It's a stretch, but it makes sense.

Making sense still doesn't change the fact it is a dumb interaction since if anything the Azir should get sped up from going through his own wall as another option to this. Vayne already dicks over Jarvan we don't need any other casualties.

When you get down to the programming semantics azirs ult is always considered a wall even if it is an allied wall.

What would be worth more testing is to see if an ally on the azirs team could also be condemned to the wall. If they to can be pinned I would not consider it a bug. If they can not be pinned to it I would think it is a bug.
I would assume that should work like so, since to the Vayne the wall is coded as terrain she can't cross.
